Chinmay Talegaonkar

Senior Undergraduate, IIT Bombay

I am interested in research in Image processing particularly using optimization and machine learning techniques. I am currently working with Prof. Ajit Rajwade for my Bachelor’s Thesis on Phase Retrieval. Apart from image processing, I am also interested in CUDA Programming and optimization. I have worked with Prof. Dirk Kroese on parallelizing Monte Carlo simulations using CUDA followed by an internship at NVidia this summer, where I worked on optimizing Capsule Networks and DBscan (a clustering algorithm).

For further insights into my work, please have a look at my CV. I maintain a brief account of my research experiences under the Research Projects tab.

I enjoy astrophysics and was involved extensively in the International Astronomy Olympiad Program as a participant while in high school and also as a academic committee member in 2016-17. I enjoy writing poetry and a bit of stand-up comedy, scenic photography, playing guitar and travelling in my leisure time.

news

Sep 8, 2018 My first research paper got accepted to IEEE GlobalSIP, to be held at Anaheim in California this November
Jul 23, 2018 Succesfully finished my internship at NVidia, Bangalore
